_comment: Drug Inventory save file which contains the same Drug values as in TypicalDrugs#getTypicalDrugInventory()

drugs.direction: The usual starting dose for adults is 20 mg once a day, typically taken in the morning.
drugs.purposes: Prozac is an antidepressant medication that is used to treat major depressive disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), bulimia nervosa, and panic disorder.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects of Prozac may include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dry mouth, headache, dizziness, and nervousness.

drugs.direction: The usual recommended dose of Robitussin for adults is 10-20 mg every 4-6 hours, up to a maximum of 120 mg per day.
drugs.purposes: Robitussin is a cough suppressant that is used to treat coughs caused by the common cold or other respiratory illnesses.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects of Robitussin may include dizziness, drowsiness, and upset stomach.

drugs.direction: The usual recommended dose of Sudafed for adults is 30-60 mg every 4-6 hours, up to a maximum of 240 mg per day.
drugs.purposes: Sudafed is a decongestant that is used to treat nasal congestion and a runny nose caused by allergies, the common cold, or other respiratory illnesses.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects of Sudafed may include headache, dry mouth, nervousness, and insomnia.

drugs.direction: The usual recommended dose of Visine for adults is 1-2 drops in the affected eye(s) up to 4 times a day.
drugs.purposes: Visine is an eye drop that is used to relieve redness in the eyes caused by minor eye irritations, such as smoke, dust, or wind.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects of Visine may include temporary stinging or burning in the eye(s), dryness, and blurred vision.

drugs.direction: The usual recommended dose of Metformin for adults is typically 500mg-1000mg taken twice daily with meals.
drugs.purposes: Metformin is an oral medication used to manage type 2 diabetes by helping to control blood sugar levels.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects of Metformin may include diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and a metallic taste in the mouth.

drugs.direction: The usual recommended dose of Imodium for adults is 4 mg initially, followed by 2 mg after each loose stool, up to a maximum of 16 mg per day.
drugs.purposes: Imodium is an over-the-counter medication used to treat acute diarrhea, including traveler's diarrhea and diarrhea associated with gastroenteritis.
drugs.sideEffects: Common side effects of Imodium may include constipation, dizziness, and drowsiness.
